posts.title: Building Apps in Public: 10,000 Lines of Code Across 8 Projects

seo.description: A look inside the testkitchen: 8 app projects, 10,349 lines of code, and the patterns that emerged from building in public.

posts.notes: Series intro - overview of all 8 testkitchen projects

posts.title: Swift/SwiftUI Patterns That Actually Scale: Lessons from 7,800 Lines of iOS Code

seo.description: Practical Swift/SwiftUI patterns from building 3 iOS apps. MVVM, value types, animations, and conventions that scale.

posts.notes: Deep dive into iOS patterns from Poker, MadLibs, QuestForge

posts.title: TypeScript Patterns for Real Projects: Factory Functions, Discriminated Unions, and Security

seo.description: TypeScript patterns from building Eliza and GTD: factory functions for testability, discriminated unions for type safety, and security at the boundaries.

posts.notes: Deep dive into TypeScript patterns from Eliza, GTD

posts.title: TDD That Actually Speeds You Up: Testing Patterns from 10K Lines of Code

seo.description: How test-driven development actually made shipping faster. Practical TDD patterns from building iOS and TypeScript apps.

posts.notes: Testing and TDD practices across all projects

posts.title: The Planning System Behind 1.6-Hour Deliveries: How GAS Changed How I Build

seo.description: How a structured planning system (GAS) enabled shipping 51 execution plans averaging 1.6 hours each across 8 projects.

posts.notes: GAS framework explanation and velocity insights
